story:
I'm Brooklyn Russell. I love babies.

"I want to be a super hero to give a baby onesie every sick baby." - Brooklyn Russell

Elvis and JJ started with an idea by Brooklyn Russell, a 9 year old, 4th Grader at Earl Warren Elementary School in Sacramento, California.  Brooklyn wanted to start her own business to make products for babies.  Her first product is a baby onesie with the Characters Elvis and JJ, that are twin birds.  

   

Elvis loves to rap and JJ is very smart in school.  Brooklyn has a partnership with The University of California Davis Children's Hospital Child Life and Creative Arts to donate baby onesies.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to donate as many baby onesies to Children's Hospitals as we can.

**********************************************************************************************

$3 Donation

You get

(1) - one (1) Elvis and JJ Wristband

(2) - one (1) Thank You Postcard showing Brooklyn at the Hospital

(3) - one (1) Email from Brooklyn thanking you for your donation


$15 Donation

You get

(1) - (1) Elvis and JJ Baby Onesies donated in your name (or you specify if different) to University of California Davis Children's Hospital Child Life and Creative Arts.

(2) - one (1) Elvis and JJ Wristband

(3) - one (1) Thank You Postcard showing Brooklyn at the Hospital

(4) - one (1) 5 x 7 Artwork by Brooklyn Russell

(5) - one (1) Email from Brooklyn thanking you for your donation


$25 Donation:

You get

(1) - two (2) Elvis and JJ Baby Onesies donated in your name (or you specify if different) to University of California Davis Children's Hospital Child Life and Creative Arts. 

(2) - one (1) Elvis and JJ Wristband

(3) - one (1) Thank You Postcard showing Brooklyn at the Hospital

(4) - one (1) 5 x 7 Artwork by Brooklyn Russell

(5) - one (1) Email from Brooklyn thanking you for your donation

If your donation surpasses $25 we will increase the amount of wristbands and artwork from Brooklyn.

Where the funds go if we don’t reach our entire goal

All funds received for Children's Hospital: Elvis and JJ Baby Onesie for every Sick Baby will go towards all items mentioned above.  We will provide baby onesies for every $15 & $25 donation.

The Impact

Each baby in Children's Hospital will receive a baby onesie.  As you know its hard to think that a baby has to be in a hospital because they are ill, but to have a nice soft and cuddly baby onesie to wear during their stay would be a blessing. 

The parent who has a child who is sick in the hospital has lots on their mind.  If we can alleviate one portion of their expense while they are there in the hospital with their baby, it would be nice.


About Brooklyn:

To read Brooklyn's story please visit http://www.elvisandjj.com

Also see Brooklyn on Good Day Sacramento talking about helping babies:  

Brooklyn loves to share her art work and her art will be featured in the Homes of families that were previously homeless, featured on Motor City Rising on the OvationTV Network being designed by Treger Strasberg of Humble Design http://www.humbledesign.org in Detroit Michigan.  She will also be featured on Good Day Sacramento with Julissa Ortiz http://gooddaysacramento.cbslocal.com/video/9732936-elvis-and-jj/

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that these times of tremendously hard and if you are not able to contribute to the Children's Hospital Campaign we would love for you share the indiegogo share tool, tweet or facebook our hashtag #ElvisAndJJBabyOnesie.

story:
Hi my name is Kristy Lockhart and my best friend was diagnosed with Lyme Disease in 2012 after being misdiagnosed for many years. It took her years and at least 100 doctors/hospital/specialist appointments and visits to finally receive a proper diagnosis.

In March 2014 Heather was 50% better in beating lyme, this has to do with her amazing lyme doctor & her extraordinary chiropractor and naturopath team & her own strength. Heather was on same antibiotics for 18 months, she got bit by ‘something’ weeks ago, ever since then she went from being 50% better to only 10% better with 80% of her previous lyme symptoms returning. She was bit by an unknown bug in late march which caused her ankle to turn red and swell double it’s size, insane itch, she wasn’t able to walk and I took her to the hospital emergency 3 times in one week to get no help, no referrals, nothing. For the last 6 months there was so much improvement, so much hope and light, and now, to be perfectly honesty, we are scared. Physically and neurologically it is as if Heather’s state is as it was before we even started lyme treatment back in September 2012. I have to help her wash her hair, I have to prepare all of her meals, do her laundry and dishes as her joints are swollen, painful and inflamed and she can’t do the things she normally did for the last 6 months as this new ‘infection’ is making all symptoms return that were seemingly gone. We have made an emergency appointment to go back to her lyme doctor only a month after seeing her, as everything we were doing (medication/supplement/etc wise) is no longer working. So far, in 2014 Heather has gotten shingles 3 times & is currently trying to recover from them again. Her immune system is compromised and this is the cause of them recurring.

Thank you to heather’s loving online family, on redbubble and face book, to her friends and even strangers that have donated in the past, shared this link, and supported her with love, kindness and patience and unconditional love during her journey. I couldn’t have helped heather go this far without all of you beautiful souls, and I don’t know what we would do without you. It’s a scary time, Heather likes to put on a brave face, but I myself am not only her best friend, but caregiver and have been watching her rapidly decline over the last few weeks. I need your help now more than ever.

If you know you were bitten by a tick and seek immediate treatment in Canada you go on antibiotics for a few weeks and you’re cured. If you didn’t know you were bit by a tick the tick not only infects you with a devastating bacteria, but it lays its eggs in your body which hatch in 18 days. Heather went almost 4 years in extreme physical pain, I watched her mind and body deteriorate in the most devastating way. Going to every medical appointment, ambulance ride, neurosurgeon, MRI, family dr visit and never getting an answer, having it all blamed on her ‘anxiety’ I decided to take matters into my own hands and researched full time, it was months of extensive research that all signs and symptoms pointed to lyme disease. In Canada treatment beyond a month is NOT available. Chronic lyme is not treated in Canada, and the few doctors who have done so, have lost their license. This is why we have to travel to the USA every 3 months for treatment and expensive antibiotics which are not covered.

The majority of people with Lyme disease are misdiagnosed for years and by the time it is discovered it is almost too late.

In 2009 Heather had a gym membership, walked 5 miles a day, hiked, spent time in nature, and constantly doing photo shoots. Now, she can't walk more than 20 minutes, becomes so fatigued far too quickly, has difficulty breathing, chest pains, migraines, her joints swell up so bad she can't write or type, difficulty folding laundry, doing dishes and playing with her cat. Something in her body is malfunctioning as her entire body is covered in edema.

This woman means everything to me. I can't put into words how I love her. She is an amazing artist/photographer (www.locustgirl.comwww.redbubble.com/people/locustgirl) and a genuine pure soul and there's nothing I won't do for her. Meeting someone like this only happens once in a lifetime, and I fear her lifetime will be over soon if her medical treatment is unable to continue.

Donating to this campaign will ensure proper medical care and treatment and lodging while undergoing this care. It doesn't matter if it's $1 or $1000 every little bit helps. Even if you have no $ to donate, please will you post this on various social networking tools to spread the word?

Even while ill, both she and I helped out with other fundraisers (Rideau Valley Wildlife Sanctuary) by donating hundreds of dollars worth of her art to be sold to help treat injured wildlife. She went to college to learn how to take care of the disabled, now she is disabled.

On a happier note, Heather got to spend time with her favorite wild snowy owl this year, snowy momma goddess and this owl was/is the reason why Heather continues to have hope/fight, as 3.5 yrs ago she had lyme and no one would help/diagnose her, and meeting this owl, watching this owl survive and brave the cold ALONE is what motivated Heather to change her life for the better, mentally and emotionally.

-if you look under the tab ‘gallery’ you will see photographs of this beautiful owl and many other wildlife photos that we are offering as a perk, our gift to you for donating.

Please check out her wildlife photography as they will make you fall even deeper in love with wildlife. Heather (when she is able to go out) has this deep soulful connection with animals and it clearly shows in her photography.

She left home at 15 and she has no blood relatives who can help her, and she hasn't worked for years due to being so ill. I am a single woman and the ONLY person who has been helping her for years, please can you help me help her?

Any questions or for a list of the prints you would like, please email me here lockhart_ottawa@hotmail.com

I promise you if you were to meet Heather you would love her almost as much as I do. I have never met another soul with such an enormous loving heart as hers. Please helps us

Love,

Kristy

WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Donating

Perks

$5 - a photograph of heather holding a thank you note with your name on it emailed to you

$15 - a handmade wildlife thank you card with a hand written note to you written by Heather snail mailed to your door.

$20 - a 1 minute audio/voice email of Heather thanking you and acknowledging gratitude for your help

$40 - 8x10 or 8x12 photograph, your choice from the ‘gallery’ tab or her website.

$50 - a personal thank you video made especially to you and a personal handmade card/written and snail mailed to your door.

$100 - 11x14 or 12x18 signed photographic print of your choice from Heather snail mailed to your door

$250 - Ten 8x10 photographic prints of your choice snail mailed to your door

$500 - if you’re in the Ottawa area, I am a gourmet chef, and would be pleased to your cater your event or an intimate meal in your home. (my labor is free, the cost of food would have to be covered by you)

$1000 - if you live in the Ottawa/montreal area, my dear friend has 20 yrs experience as a plumber/electrician, welder and he would work for you for a day doing whatever repairs/renovations you wish.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t contribute financially, that’s okay we understand. Spreading the word via social networking sites helps tremendously.

Always check yourself and loved ones for ticks. They are the size of a poppy seed. Anytime after hiking, camping, out in nature, have your friend to a full body tick check, this could save your life.

MEDICAL BREAKDOWN

Monthly costs in Canada

- travel expenses to medical appointments, pain specialists, etc ( $200)

- vitmans, supplements, tinctures, probiotics of a specific nature ($500)

(none of this is covered, this is all out of pocket)

- chiropractic / naturopathic / acupuncture treatments ($1000)

Every 3 months trip to USA

- travel expenses ($100)

- doctors visit ($500)

- antibiotics ($1500 - $2500)

Tests that are needed that we cannot afford in the USA

- $1000 +

story:
Hey guys

My name is Sarah. I am a 20 year old with a medical history as long as a Game of Thrones novel. My hope with this campaign is that I can rid myself of the dept that I have accumulated through the several medical calamities that seem to keep happening. Recently, I underwent a wisdom teeth extraction surgery which paralyzed half my tongue. I still have a little over $500 left to pay on it. Less than a month later I began to develop symptoms of a family hip disorder called FAI. Basically I have an impingement on my hip and a tear in the labrum. I am no longer permitted to run, jog, jump, or perform any high impact activity. Really hoping the zombie apocalypse doesn't come anytime soon. But anyway, the doctors are hoping they caught it early enough to correct it with therapy. This therapy is going to cost me around $420. Now some people may say this isn't all that much but on my paycheck, after my bills, its next to impossible. I didn't want to have to make this campaign but I realized I shouldn't be afraid to ask for help. So if anyone would like to help feel free. Remember every little bit is something and it helps.

story:
A revolutionary mini water cooler that filters tap & faucet water into crystal clear drinking water.

The world’s first ever true Mini Water Cooler that filters tap water using a  SGS France tested and NSF certified filter medium that removes Lead and other impurities to such an extent that it exceeds NSF requirements and really cools the water using a powerful ultra energy-efficient cooling system that's environmentally friendly. The “Little Luxury” is ideal for your desk, home, your gym, your dorm, your bar and holiday home. At only 19.5 inches high ,6.5 inches wide and weighing under 7 pounds, it is the perfect compact filter and cooler for a healthy lifestyle.The unit we are offering on Indiegogo is the first to have the largest cooling tank of 44 fl. oz in its class. Quite simply, there is nothing else that is as affordable, efficient or as cute as the Little Luxury mini water cooler. This water cooler is an incredible gift.


Quick Facts 

• The first mini water cooler to make ice cold water cooling down to a remarkable 44°F (6°C) at room  temp of 86°F (30°C)
• Can produce 3 glasses of ice cold perfectly filtered water one after the other.
• Easy to fill bottle from tap, kids and elderly can replace bottle on their own.
• Light, compact and very cute. Personal and fits anywhere.  This personal cooler is very hygienic.
• Has a easy to use filter housing, Making replacing the filter cartridge simple and fast. 
• Removes 98.9% lead and most common pesticides found in tap water.-SGS France Tested.
•  Has optimized cooling technology, winning the Global Nestle innovation award.
• Fast flow, as fast as a large water cooler!
• The first mini water cooler that is so energy efficient. 
• Low carbon manufacture foot print, no oil, steel and copper tubing.
• All materials are food grade. 
• Bottle is made with durable Tritan from Eastman plastic USA that is BPA free.

Our amazing Cooler Is Perfect For Personal Use




                                                       Our Innovative Technology

•  The “Little Luxury” Vitality filter cartridge has Silver Microtech technology which neutralizes bacteria on contact and selected grades of advanced NSF certified filter resin ion which removes contaminants and heavy metals such as lead and chromium. 
•  Utilizes aeronautical and space age engineering software to optimize performance and reduce materials.
•  Virtually Silent and can produce three glasses of ice cold filtered water one after the other.

The Vitality filter cartridges are affordable, giving you the highest level of filtration.

Our filter has a unique design to prevent cross contamination between filtered and unfiltered water. We have a design registration on our feathered edge and O-ring double sealing The filters have proprietary technology design to ensure that the water flows down through the filter like rain. Making it significantly different from general filters that forms a vortex and only filters 20% of the water. Our Vitalty filters, filter 100% of the water flowing through and remarkably improves the taste .

User and Eco-Friendly

•  The amount of plastic bottles manufactured every year causes pollution. You can help the environment to reduce the number of plastic bottles used.You will be surprised to find that approximately 40% or more of the bottled water is just plain tap water. A shocking 80% of plastic bottles produced are not recycled.

 Having large diesel polluting trucks delivering big heavy water bottles to your home or office is simply crazy and totally unacceptable , when you can filter your own water from your tap to a 99.8% level of purity and greatly reduce the carbon buildup in this world. You can refill you water cooler with municipal or city faucet or tap water. It’s easy because of its large opening and spill proof cap on the bottle.



Technical spesifications

•Power 220 Volt AC 50 Hz

•Amps 1- max 5,8 amps

•Watts 72 Watts intermittent. Averaging between 30-40 watts.

•MET Approved

•FDA  Approved

•SGS  Tested

•UL Certified board

•Stabilized Chipsets- patented 

•Flow rate – approximately 9 fl oz (266 ml) in 10 seconds.

•Cooling down to approximately  44-47°F (6-8°C ) – ambient area temperatures  69F-95F (20- 35°C)

•NSF certified carbon

•NSF certified resin iron

•Food grade plastic

•Stabilized patented chip sets

•TRITAN Easteman BPA free bottle

Our journey 

Gary Flax, the inventor of this amazing water cooler wanted to make a cooler that was affordable and really worked well. Together with a dynamic team of engineers and water scientists he insured that the “Little Luxury” water cooler and Vitality Filter cartridge will give you crystal clean healthy drinking water at your finger tips without causing harm to the environment.

“Little Luxury’s” award winning products comply with the highest health and safety standards from around the world. Our Vitality water filters produce great tasting, filtered water that is safe to drink. They are SGS France tested and the medium is NSF certified.

story:
Fig + Clover, a boutique hair and skin studio in the up and coming Temescal neighborhood of Oakland California is launching it’s own hair care line. Ari Huitzilopochtli started Fig + Clover two years ago and was unsatisfied with typical hair care products containing chemicals that are harsh on both hair and the environment. She decided to take matters into her own hands and has been working with a chemist to start a product line derived from natural and botanical ingredients. She is already using three of the products in her shop and her clients are thrilled with what they see, feel, and smell! We need your generous contributions to help launch the rest of the line.

All funding received will go directly into the product line itself.

If you are unable to contribute financially, please consider spreading the word via social media, or good old word of mouth!

A little more about Ari and Fig + Clover:

Ari has worked in different salons throughout the San Francisco Bay Area. When a job brought her to Temescal, she knew it was where she wanted to be because people are invested in the community and each other. She thinks of Temescal as a big family where not everyone knows each others’ names but they love and support each other anyway - this is part of the reason she hates the word client. To her, everyone who comes into the studio is family in some capacity.  She took the leap of opening her own business because she trusted in the Temescal community and her loyal client ‘family’ that has followed her throughout the years. Now that Fig + Clover is established, she takes pleasure in being able to help support other new businesses in the neighborhood.

story:
About the Tour

Did you know that APEX Movement started the 1st parkour classes in the Western Hemisphere 7 yrs. ago? Since then, few organizations in the world have helped spread the benefits of parkour as much as APEX Movement. With 3 gym locations in CO, APEX Movement has taught thousands of people and entertained even more through performances, commercials, and online videos.

For the 2nd summer in a row, APEX Movement is touring 5000 miles across the USA and Canada to train, film, teach, and document the parkour lifestyle through high quality media. This year, the crew consists of Ryan Ford, Amos Rendao, Dylan Baker, Jake Smith, Cosmo Dudley, and Justin Clark.

Packing 6 people into a van for this tour takes a lot of hard work, time, and money. With your contributions, we will be able to fund our expenses such as food, transportation, and lodging. Additionally, we would love to be able to pay these amazing athletes and film makers a modest stipend for the instruction provided and epic media that will result from this tour.

June 24 - Denver, CO
June 24-26 - Minneapolis, MN (http://www.facebook.com/events/315351528553448/)
June 26-29 - Chicago, IL (http://www.facebook.com/events/325195577566028/)
June 29-July 2 - Toronto, ON (http://www.facebook.com/events/460042324006114/)
July 2-5 - Montreal, QC (http://www.facebook.com/events/370719699649410/)
July 5-8 - Boston, MA
July 8-9 - Fairfield, CT
July 9-12 - NYC, NY
July 12-15 - Philadelphia, PA (http://www.facebook.com/events/274502509324669/)
July 15-17 - Sandusky, OH
July 17-18 - Kansas City, MO

See Some of Our Previous Work

APEX Movement 2012 Showreel - http://youtu.be/m7ly6cSrzkE

2011 Parkour Tour Teaser - http://youtu.be/G5FNzRDxFWQ

Why You Should Donate

APEX Movement is a world leader in the development of safe parkour instruction. We have spent 7 years refining our curriculum and teachning methods for parkour. By traveling around and sharing these ideas with other parkour communities, we can all benefit through collaboration and encouraging safe, efficient training methods.

Additionally, we love to make parkour videos to share with the world for free online. Doing this takes a lot of work and time. We could sell the videos for a fee, but we would rather post them for free online so that people all around the world can access them easily and be inspired to further their own training.

What We Will Use the Money For

  • Paying 6 athletes to perform, teach, and coordinate the 25 day tour.
  • Funding 6 athletes to eat for 25 days.
  • Tour van maintenance.
  • Gas expenses for 5000 miles of driving.
  • Other miscellaneous expenses including parking fees, train tickets, laundry, and more.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

  • Want to help us get the word out? You can help by sharing this fundraiser with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, parkour websites, and more.
  • Tell everyone about our jams and seminars in each city. If you have friends or family in one of our stops, get them to come out and join us!

Questions?

Feel free to send an email to parkour@apexmovement.com!

story:
Short Summary

We would like to introduce to you our project and our team. 

Our team is from Canada, the USA, the UK, and the UAE. We have come together to pursue the shared passion of improving the health and well being of people who are constantly traveling, while at the same time creating a fulfilling and positive impact in communities around the globe.

Our app, Flying Foods, recommends the healthiest food options
available in airports across North America. This app offers an easier
way to eat healthy while traveling by providing detailed information
about menu items and personalization in food choices and eating times.
It also provides healthy eating tips that are targeted to educate
users on the benefits of good foods. Every app downloaded generates a
donation to Food Water Health, a non-profit organization working to
educate people in underdeveloped areas of the world how to use their
surrounding resources to plant nutritious foods and harvest much
needed natural medicines.

 

We are building a smart phone app so that people can take the tools we build and the education we are providing with them no matter where they go.   

The Flying Foods app is and channel where we can connect and support people and communities. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding needed for this project is $4000.00 Let me tell you exactly how we will be spending the money.  We have three key requirements to drive the success of the Flying Foods Project. 

  • Requirement 1- The Flying Foods mobile platform to connect people and information
  • Requirement 2- The ability for us to provide the essentials of the project for ecological design success, this includes the plants, soil and transportation infrastructure. 
  • Requirement 3- People to go to the project locations and build the ecological design gardens.

If we do not reach our goal, the funds will be not be spent until we can guarantee project success.

We want to give you something for donating. Please see the "Perks" page to see what we offer in return for your support.

The Impact

We are committed to delivering The Flying Foods App to the marketplace
and creating a positive social impact in the world. We have the energy,
passion and experience to carry the project through on a global scale
in the long-term and introduce millions of people to healthier foods
and sustainable ecological design practices. Healthy soil grows
healthy food; healthy food grows healthy people; healthy people create
healthy change in the world. Flying Foods is not the answer, it’s the
beginning.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • We appreciate any amount of support given, and we know the power in sharing ideas. Please help us share our passion for making the world a healthier more sustainable place to live by telling your friends about Flying Foods.  If you are passionate about eating healthy and supporting community gardens and food forests then please reach out to us we would love to hear from you.  Chat with us by dropping us a mail at brightevolutions@gmail.com

story:
"Each Small Kindness, Like A Seed, Grows Tall In Memory~" origin unknown

Our Number One Perks: Bee the Change Teeshirt

FU Monsanto!  

What Is HoneyColony?

 

Remember when your mom used to tell you to eat your peas and carrots? 

Remember when peas and carrots weren't smothered in pesticides?

We're a hive of health-conscious writers, consumers and foodies who want to share our stories and exchange information with you, your friends and everyone else who wants full disclosure about our bodies and what goes into them. For every yummy hotdog and every bag of glowing Cheetos, we bring wisdom without the guilt. Like you, we care about the plight of the honeybees. And we have a few questions. Do soybeans cause cancer? Are GMO foods behind the soaring rates of autism and obesity? Where can we find a luscious bar of organic raw chocolate? Do we want every patch of soil to be patented? 

Why HoneyColony?

As an investigative health news forum, we curate great information and alternative viewpoints, and introduce you to sustainable products from conscious vendors. You'll find amazing skin care, superfoods and supplements from companies with integrity including Puro3, Healthforce Nutritionals and Essential Living Foods. 


When Did HoneyColony Arrive?

Our founder, Maryam Henein, followed the puzzling fate of the vanishing bees after experiencing her own near-death experience. On the road to recovery, she discovered alternative healing practices, superfoods and the power of information. She directed the award-winning documentary film, Vanishing of the Bees, which takes a scrutinizing look at big agriculture and Mother Earth, and launched HoneyColony in December 2012.


How Does HoneyColony Help?

Our health is collective, regardless of health insurance, health care or politics. Each of us has a health challenge, even if it's not our own. We have a friend, brother, mother, aunt or colleague who's got something that came from somewhere. We want to find out how and why disease has become so popular. The more knowledge we have, the more capable we'll be of making better decisions about what we consume. At the end of the day, we live in a supply-and-demand world. If we don't buy it, they won't sell it. So we need to be one loud voice!

Check out this clip from Founder Maryam Henein

http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=oe10maAqrko

What's The Social Life Like At HoneyColony?


It's pretty sweet. We offer BeeBucks for active members. Post a comment, write a review via Twitter or Facebook or share with friends and we'll reward you with our virtual currency. Use it to check out any of our products and get started on a new regimen, diet, outlook or practice.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Every dollar raised will go toward building a bigger, better, more solid and expansive HoneyColony platform that can be more easily shared with friends, family members and everyone in your inner circle who wants to stay balanced, aligned and informed.

We are setting an initial goal of $21,000 to complete the following:

1) HoneyColony Mobile version, to enable members to read, evaluate, shop and share via their mobile devices ($16,000). More than 50% of our users are on mobile but our platform isn't yet fully functional.

2) A social dashboard for more functionality in our online community of active members. (5,000)

In honor of your support, we are offering wonderfully healthy organic perks such as wild honey from Africa, organic ozonated skin creams, raw chocolate, Vanishing of the Bees on dvd, autographed by Ellen Page, and more!

We're also donating a percentage of the proceeds to two awesome organizations:

The Learning Garden in Venice, a model example of how school gardens can transform the lives of students and teachers, and enhance the environment of a community.

HoneyLove, a Los Angeles based 501(c)3 nonprofit conservation organization with a mission to protect the honeybees and inspire and educate new urban beekeepers.

Thanks for supporting our hive and for allowing us to stay connected with you throughout health challenges and radiant times! Be in touch and let's put honesty back into mainstream health! We're at info@honeycolony.com

story:
Sweet Lilly's Journey:

So far in little Lilly's life, she has been diagnosed with Optic Nerve Hypoplasia (she's legally blind) at 2 months, and suffered a stroke at 11 months old. These are 2 very rare, and unrelated instances. Being young, she is recovering from the stroke and with the help of adequate care, she will grow up strong and healthy :) 

October 26th is a day I'll never forget.  I went in to get Lilly out of her crib and found her slumped against the rails, like she couldn't get her arms up to pull herself up.  I didn't think much of it and went about with her morning feeding.  We quickly noticed she would fall on her right arm when crawling and her fist was in a closed position.  This began an 11 day journey of tryins to diagnose why my baby wouldn't use her right arm/hand.  Once we diagnosed her stroke with an MRI, we began running multiple tests because we needed to know why she stroked...was it her heart, her blood, or her brain's vessels.  We ultimately found out that she has a narrowed blood vessel on the left side of her brain that spasmed, and caused a stroke.  This is now something we have to monitor to make sure the vessel doesn't continue to close, potentially causing more strokes.  The hope is the vessel will either stay the same, or possibly open back up.  Lilly is currently on asprin daily to keep her blood thin so it can pass through the narrowed vessel.  

Although she has insurance, the deductible is large and the hospital stays, multiple MRI's, angiograms of the brain and heart, etc are only covered 70%. We work very hard to stay on top of the growing list of monthly payments, but we've had to stop paying other things to do so.  We want to continue being able to provide for her and her brother, while maintaining access to the quality of care she needs :| Looking into next year, we will be monitoring the area of the brain that stroked, with an MRI, every 3 months. Thus far, her MRI's are costing around $3,500 out of pocket (we had an MRI back in March to diagnose her ONH with her eyes). Our out of pocket deducatble is $9,000...thus the $9,000 goal.  Any of this recovery fund will go straight into a new checking account we have already created to pay (current and upcoming) medical bills from. 

Lilly is such an amazing gift. I joke that she is my "ever serious baby" :) She is so curious about the world around her, I am constantly wondering what she is seeing and thinking.  She has a very calm and curious demeanor, but can be very spunky and happy when she is surrounded by her family.  She is such a sweet baby and she continually amazes us.  When we found out about her eyes, one of our biggest worries was not setting the bar high enough for our visually impaired baby. Where is that happy medium of pushing her to learn, but not letting fail?  We can tell you that daily, she shows us she can do anything like a "normal" baby.  And now with her stroke, she is just learning to adapt without her right arm.  She just goes on and nothing seems to bother her.  We have learned so much from her in her short 11 months with us.  I hope those reading this either know her or get a chance to meet her one day.  She is a true gift from God, and we are blessed to be her parents. 

Touching on the fact that her stroke took over 11 days to diagnose.  We went through 2 ER visits, an orthopedic doctor, a urget care doctor, and our pediatrician.  No one suspected that a baby so young could have suffered a stroke.  We asked anyone that would listen why they thought our baby wouldn't use her right arm, and kept it in a balled fist.  After more research, it shows that 11 out of 100,000 babies have strokes each year.  Needless to say, pediatric stroke awareness is nowhere near where it should be.  This is somthing our family is looking into immedately.  You can find a wealth of information about pediatric stroke on the CHASA website! You can even join and become a member and just "tell somebody" that KIDS HAVE STROKES TOO! :)

Great fact sheet about pediatric strokes :http://www.chasa.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/chasa_pediatric_stroke_fact_sheet_2012.pdf

Website and organization dedicated to pediatric stroke awareness: http://www.chasa.org/you-can-help/pediatric-stroke-awareness/

 

Thank you so much for sharing in Lilly's story! 

Gig'em Ags :)

John, Cari, Lilly, and (big brother) Ben

story:
Our Story

Mother Nature's Belly Pregnancy & Lactation Center Inc is a community based non-profit maternal and infant health organization.  Our mission is to uphold the organic nature of pregnancy and childbirth, offer woman-centered care beginning in the preconception phase, throughout pregnancy and the postpartum period and related community education.  We firmly believe in offering services, support and education that aid in reproductive equality, positive birth outcomes, decreased infant mortality rates and healthy mothers and babies.

The Impact

The Bellies, Birth & Babies Project is a fund raising effort which will provide the funds necessary to train 20 women as Community Doulas.  The project is geared towards low-income women and young mothers.  While the project will provide vital pregnancy and birth support to expectant and new mothers, it will also enhance the community by providing employment opportunities to women who often are underserved.

A doula helps fill this gap by providing support to the woman and her partner or support system throughout the childbearing year. A doula does not replace the support system; instead, they help support them so that they can focus on loving and encouraging the laboring woman. Doulas can serve as a source of information during pregnancy, labor and birth. A doula assists families in gathering information about their pregnancy, labor and the options available for delivery.

Doulas provide continuous physical, emotional, and informational support before and during labor, birth, and the immediate postpartum period. The intent of a doula is to help the woman have a safe and satisfying experience, as the woman defines it.

Doula support has positive effects on...

Birth Outcomes:
Labors are shorter.
There are fewer complications.
Cesarean rates are reduced.
There is less need for oxytocin to speed up labor.
Need for forceps is reduced.
Women request less pain medication and epidurals

The Mother:
Greater satisfaction with their birth experience.
More positive assessments of their babies.
Less postpartum depression.

The Baby:
Babies have shorter hospital stays with fewer admissions to special care nurseries.
Babies breastfeed more easily.
Mothers are more affectionate to their babies postpartum.

The Health Care System:
The cost of obstetrical care is dramatically reduced.
Women are pleased with the personalized care doulas offer.

What We Need

Our 2012 goal for the Bellies, Birth & Babies Fundraiser is $5,500.  The funds will enable us to train 20 women as labor/postpartum doulas. The funds will be divided up as follows:

Each doula trainee will receive:

*A $250 scholarship to cover tuition expenses associated with the Community Doula Training & Certification Program
*Course materials
*A $25 transportation stipend
*One year certification, membership and mentorship

All donations are tax deductible on your 2012 tax return.  Mother Nature's Belly Pregnancy & Lactation Center Inc is a tax-exempt non profit organization (Tax ID # 27-5409284).  

 
Other Ways You Can Help

The work we do at Mother Nature's Belly Pregnancy & Lactation Center is paramount to the health and wellness of mother's and babies in our community.  We ask that you please share this fund raising campaign with those in your circle.  It's the contributions from our community and those who support our work that makes our program a success!  Thank You!

story:
A new line of supplements specifically tailored towards dancers and athletes looking to maximize their potential

My name is Cassandra Yasko and I am both a dancer and the founder of Cloud Nine Supplements. Growing up I benefited from my mother’s holistic healthcare practice, and as such I have always been conscious of the benefits of natural supplementation.  However, through my experiences as a dancer I realized most of my friends and peers weren’t aware of the healthy alternatives they could use to support themselves and their practice. I want to raise awareness and education throughout the dance community about the benefits of proper supplementation.  It is this mission that inspired me to found Cloud Nine.

I am hoping to raise $8,000 to help formulate and expand my product line, as well create a user friendly e-commerce site that will primarily serve as a hub for information and resources on health and wellness for dancers at all levels. 

Equipped with an understanding of health and wellness, alongside the powerful effects of proper supplementation, I believe dancers have their best chance for optimal performance and avoiding common injury and fatigue.

I worked very hard to put together a set of prizes for everyone who believes and supports my mission! From beautiful die cut stickers and the first Cloud Nine supplements, to custom Nalgene bottles and GAIA yoga mats, I've included prizes that will help support your active, healthy lifestyle! 

Thank you for your time and support of Cloud Nine!
Cassandra 

 


 

To view our supplement facts larger, please click here:
